comment.author: 60861613@N00
comment._content: Sir Thomas Vansittart Bowater, 1st Baronet DL (29 October 1862 – 28 March 1938) was a British Conservative Party politician who served as Lord Mayor of London from 1913 to 1914 and as one of the City's Member of Parliament from 1924 to 1938. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_Vansittart_Bowater

comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called ANYTHING GOES ENGLAND,VINTAGE PHOTOS,POSTCARDS,EPHEMERAetc..., and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: He is wearing the chain of office and regalia of a Lord Mayor in this photo.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
I happened to be in London with my parents in the autumn of 1956. We had the luck to be spectators at the Lord Mayor's parade. The LM at that time (Sir Cullum Welch) was dressed up just like this -- it's a big deal over there.

I was surprised to learn that, in addition to the Lord Mayor of London (now officially Lord Mayor of the City of London) there is also a Mayor of London. The Mayor of London doesn't get the title of Lord, but he governs a much larger chunk of territory called Greater London.
